quest.name: Words without Sound
journal: Emet-Selch seems content to stay where he is.
objectives: Search for Meteion beneath the Hungering Gardens.
Search for Meteion north of the Hungering Gardens.
Search for Meteion east of the Hungering Gardens.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Hm? Why am I always so forward thinking? I simply wish to enjoy all that life has to offer!

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: I was prepared to swoop in if need be, but 'tis clear you have faced your fair share of monstrous opponents.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Hermes said he would not be long, yes? Then we shall wait here until he emerges...

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Ugh, this is an exercise in futility... You have to be the one to find her, Forename! Follow her voice!

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: If I cannot perceive her aether, what else have I to offer but my rousing support!? Ahh, Hermes truly is a master of his craft...

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: I've strained my senses to their limits, but found nothing. You must calm your mind, that you might hear it─that you might feel her silent voice!

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: Meteion! Where are you!? Please, answer me! What has happened to you? To your sisters...?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You calm your mind, your senses questing for any hint of Meteion's presence...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ...But you fail to hear her voice. She must be elsewhere.

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: (-Meteion-)It seeps...into my mind... Our voices... Reporting...

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: (-Meteion-)No, no! Hermes mustn't hear them! I have to run...to hide...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Meteion's anguished voice grows distant as the source seems to flee down the slope...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You strain to catch even the faintest whisper, but fail to hear Meteion's voice. She must be elsewhere...

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: (-???-)Greetings...and salutations...

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: Commencing report...

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: Oh...oh no, we can't tell them that! We must run... Run far away!

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: Please... Don't follow me...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Meteion's anguished voice fades as you sense her climbing to the top of the ridge...

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: (-Meteion-)How...? How did it come to this...?

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: (-Meteion-)Is this the reason we traveled to the stars? Why we sought out other life-forms?

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: (-Meteion-)Is this it? Is this the answer!? No, it cannot be...it cannot be!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Meteion's anguished voice drifts away to the south...

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: (-???-)Compiling report for dissemination to Hermes and all peoples of Etheirys...

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: Processing expedition data... Preparing profiles on intelligent civilizations...

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: Formulating answers to the question...

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: Finalizing report...

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: No, Forename... You mustn't listen!

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: It's wrong...it's all wrong...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Meteion's anguished voice flees towards the lake...

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Any sign of Meteion?

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Panicked and confused... Which will make it all the more difficult to predict her movements.

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: Hermes. What do you make of this situation?

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: The Meteia are linked to a single mind─a shared consciousness which connects them across any distance. I suspect something has happened which disrupted its usual harmony...

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: How might we access this shared consciousness of theirs?

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: Much as you would approach any sentient being: directly.

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: In the Meteia's case, that means speaking to any incarnation within physical reach.

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: So unless we can track down the Meteion we just lost, we have no means to communicate with them...

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: No way of knowing what befell her sisters; no way to provide directions or guidance.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Then we had best set our musings aside, and concentrate on how we might find her!

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: A frantic search will avail us little. We must be clever about this...

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: 'Tis a shame there is no registered concept we could use to create another Meteion. Assuming of course we could link her to the shared mind! But no, if it were a viable solution, Hermes would have surely suggested it...

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: In the Final Days, aether is twisted by the invasion of dynamis from beyond the star, its progress intensified by feelings of fear and despair and anguish...

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: Nay, I like not the picture which emerges with these latest pieces.

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: Oh, my dear Meteion... What did you witness out there that frightened you so?

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: Why do you seek to keep it from us? How terrible could it possibly be...?
